reviews.review_msg: This is the first time Ron has taught 314 (New Venture Finance) and he basically reads out of the book and writes it on the board. He really doesn't put a lot of effort into the class. However, he's a relaxed and likeable guy.  Exams are moderate-difficult and sometimes he goes through material quite quickly.

Joshua has experience in the industry, however, I find him not very clear in explaining concepts. He asks us questions and engages in discussion for the whole class, however, I find this method hard to follow at times as I don't know which students provided correct or incorrect interpretations. I wasn't able to take a lot away from each class.

Such a great professor, very knowledgeable about his field of entrepreneurship and innovation. Learned so much real-life applicable stuff in just a semester. He also brings guest lecturers and visitors from the real business world to share their experiences with students and suggests quality content podcasts. Highly recommended!
